name: 華國媛
objective:
Nanomaterials are materials with a single unit small sized between 1 and 100 nm.  They have unique optical, electronic, thermo-physical or mechanical properties. Since some nanomaterials have properties of enzyme-like characteristics.They are artificial enzyme, which can be used for many applications in such as biosensing, bioimaging, tumor diagnosis and so on.  We will also discuss about the safety issues, regulation and public percpetin on nanomaterials. 
Students are expected to learn the types, the basic theory, unique properties of nanomaterials, the syntehsis and characterization of nanomaterials. This class is for upper level undergraduate students, with interested on material science and nanotechnology.
schedule:
Week        Title
1      Introduction on nanomarterials- nanotechnology in the ancient days and nature
2.     Different types of nanomaterials - OD, 1D, 2D and 3D
3.     Bulk nanomaterials - nanocrystalline materials, nanocomposites, nanoporous material
4. Bulk nanomaterials- metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), inorganic-organic hybrid nanocomposites
5.    Quantum mechanics and Jellium model
6.    Electrical properties - ballistic transport, Coulomb blockade
7.    Magnetic nanoparticles and superparamagnetism
8.    Surface properties
9.    Midterm Exam
10.  Mechanical properties & Stabilisation 
11.  Optical properties 
12.  Core-shell nanoparticles and gold nanoshells
13.   Carbon nanoworld - fullerenes, graphenes and carbon nanotubes
14.   Synthesis of nanomaterials - vapour and solution phases
15.   Characterization of nanomaterials - SPM, STM, AFM, SEM, TEM, XR
16.    Applications of nanomaterials and nanotechnology
17.    Safety Issues, Regulations and Public Perception
18.    Final exam
